title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: 'We aren't diagnosing many cancers now'
description: Planned surgery has been cancelled across the NHS - there may be some big changes when it resumes.

title: TV in lockdown: How shows are coping without a studio audience
description: Some TV shows are struggling without a crowd - but others have arguably improved.

title: Coronavirus immunity: Can you catch it twice?
description: Immunity is the crucial question and understanding it will tell us how the pandemic will end.

title: The Uber driver evicted from home and left to die of coronavirus
description: Rajesh Jayaseelan found himself homeless and sick in London with Covid-19. His widow tells his story.

title: Coronavirus: Families foster pets during outbreak
description: As animal shelters are forced to limit operations, many people have applied to temporarily rehome a pet.

title: Coronavirus: Florida pastor continues in-person services
description: Pastor Rich Vera is among a minority in America who say it’s appropriate to gather to worship.

title: Ethereal image of Cosmos flowers wins photo competition
description: A photo of Cosmos flowers wins the International Garden Photographer of the Year's Black & White photo project.

title: Stressed firms look for better ways to source products
description: The way firms get their raw materials may change rapidly now Covid-19 has disrupted supply chains.

title: Coronavirus: 'I returned my suits and spent £100 on joggers'
description: Demand for casual clothing is soaring during the lockdown, but is the UK at risk of dressing down too much?

title: Coronavirus: How the lockdown is affecting 5 Live callers
description: Three listeners tell Nicky Campbell about the impact of coronavirus on them and their families.

title: Fifa proposes five subs once action restarts to help with number of games
description: Teams will be given "temporary dispensation" to make five substitutions to help with the congested schedule they could face when the season resumes, says Fifa.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson says this is moment of maximum risk
description: There are signs the UK is passing the virus peak but we must be patient with the lockdown, the PM warns.

title: Coronavirus: Germans don compulsory masks as lockdown eases
description: Simple cloth masks are now mandatory on public transport and in shops within most states.

title: 'Project Restart' - Premier League steps up plans as some players return to training grounds
description: Plans to resume the Premier League season will step up this week in what has been labelled "Project Restart".

title: Coronavirus: 'I ran the London Marathon on my treadmill'
description: Complete with fake London landmarks and commentary from legendary voice of the marathon Steve Cram.

title: Ilford stabbing: Toddler and three-year-old boy killed
description: A 40-year-old man is in a critical condition in hospital and police are not looking for anyone else.

title: Zeinab Badawi mourns losing Dr Adil El Tayar to coronavirus
description: Zeinab Badawi mourns her cousin Dr Adil El Tayar, who died protecting others from Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus: Fined Lyme Bay divers from Edinburgh and Cornwall
description: Helicopters, lifeboats and a warship searched for one of the divers after a Mayday call.

title: Who did you vote the greatest British post-war manager?
description: BBC Sport's chief football writer made a shortlist of the greatest post-war British managers - but who did you vote as the best?

title: Formula 1 plan to start season in Austria as French GP called off
description: Formula 1 boss Chase Carey says he plans to start the season in Austria in July, after France became the latest country to call off its race.

title: Race Across the World victors pledge winnings to help street children
description: The globetrotting BBC series came down to a nailbiting climax on Sunday - spoiler alert!

title: Coronavirus: Timpson warns some High Street names won't survive
description: The repair company will reopen some of its outlets this week with strict safety measures in place.

title: Coronavirus: New Zealand claims no community cases as lockdown eases
description: The country has stopped community transmission of Covid-19, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says.

title: European football news: No fans at Italian games until 2021? 1bn euro bill to end La Liga?
description: Experts from Spain and Italy report on how the the coronavirus pandemic is affecting football clubs, players and fans in their countries.

title: Katelyn Ohashi: How to do a handstand with American gymnast
description: American gymnast and viral sensation Katelyn Ohashi does a step-by-step guide to show how you can do a handstand from home.

title: Coronavirus: Italy's PM outlines lockdown easing measures
description: Curbs will be relaxed from 4 May as the country records its lowest daily virus death toll in weeks.

title: The Papers: PM 'takes control' and lockdown plans revealed 'this week'
description: Boris Johnson returning to plot the UK's next steps in the coronavirus crisis dominate the front pages.

title: Coronavirus: The US resistance to a continued lockdown
description: The protesters have made global headlines but it's ideology not economics driving them.

title: Coronavirus: Spain eases lockdown measures to allow children outside
description: For the first time in six weeks, the country's children have been allowed outside to exercise and play.

title: Coronavirus: Captain Tom Moore gets Royal Mail birthday postmark
description: Royal Mail says it is "honoured" to commemorate the war veteran, who has raised £29m for the NHS.
